intro: Lunathyrium sichuanense, commonly known as Sichuan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at elevations between 1,500 and 3,000 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
